business.headline: Explained: Why stock markets are down despite GST 2.0 reformsThe BSE Sensex slipped 254.91 points to 80,463.10, while the NSE Nifty50 was down 69.25 points to 24,665.05 at 12:08 pm. Both benchmarks had gained in early trade.

ITR filing after September 15? Here's the penalty and conditions you must checkThe extended deadline to file income tax returns (ITR) for FY 2024–25 is September 15, 2025. Missing it means your return will be treated as belated, attracting penalties and interest. Here's what you need to know.

GST 2.0: Diwali gift for the middle class, but what about businesses?The GST rate cut boost to consumer sentiment is expected to drive demand, but industry experts say that the reforms also carry long-term benefits for businesses.
GST 2.0: Essentials cheaper, but these items will now cost moreWhile essentials will see meaningful relief, everyday indulgences and luxury items will carry heavier taxes.

GST cuts drive auto sector rally: Top stocks to keep on your radarWith the festive season approaching, experts believe that automobile companies will be among the biggest winners of the recent rate cuts in GST.

Sensex, Nifty extend gains as GST cut optimism fuels Dalal Street rallyThe S&P BSE Sensex gained nearly 300 points in early trade, while the Nifty50 climbed past 24,800, signalling the possibility of a fresh rally if a favourable outcome emerges on the US tariff front.

Oracle, Salesforce cut hundreds of jobs in US as tech layoffs drag on: ReportIn filings with state regulators, the two software giants disclosed plans to eliminate more than 500 jobs in the Bay Area and nearly 200 in the Seattle region. Salesforce is cutting 262 roles in San Francisco, while Oracle is eliminating 254 jobs spread across Redwood City, Pleasanton and Santa Clara.

How much will you invest in US? Trump presses tech titans at White House dinnerAt a White House dinner with top tech CEOs, Donald Trump pressed Apple, Google, Meta, and Microsoft on their US investments.

What after Armani: The way ahead for iconic Italian fashion empireGiorgio Armani, who died at 91 leaving no children, built one of the world's most iconic fashion brands and ensured its future independence through a foundation.

US scraps Biden-era plan mandating airlines to pay for flight disruptionsIn December, the US Department of Transportation under then-President Joe Biden sought public comment on the rulemaking process about whether airlines should be required to pay $200 to $300 for domestic delays of at least three hours and up to $775 for longer delays.

GST reforms: Will consumption and investment get a real boost? Experts debateA major overhaul of the Goods and Services Tax, termed GST 2.0, has been initiated, which the government is calling a significant 'Diwali bonus' for consumers and the economy.

entertainment.headline: The Conjuring Last Rites review: Horror compromised for a fairy tale closureRelease Date:Fri Sep 05, 2025The Conjuring Last Rites movie review: The Conjuring Last Rites concludes the Warrens' story with a personal investigation. The film offers emotional closure but falls short on delivering fresh horror thrills.

Inspector Zende review: Manoj Bajpayee echoes Family Man magic in mediocre filmRelease Date:Fri Sep 05, 2025'Inspector Zende' focuses on the cop who caught Charles Sobhraj twice, with Manoj Bajpayee delivering a compelling performance. The film blends period authenticity with police rivalry, but struggles with an uneven script.

Amitabh Bachchan donates Rs 11 lakh to Lalbaugcha RajaVeteran actor Amitabh Bachchan recently donated Rs 11 lakh to Lalbaugcha Raja. A viral picture of a cheque with the actor's signature has emerged online.

Kartik Aaryan, Ananya Panday dance atop bar counter at Tu Meri Main Tera wrap partyKartik Aaryan and Ananya Panday celebrated the wrap of their romantic comedy 'Tu Meri Main Tera, Main Tera Tu Meri' with a lively dance to Amitabh Bachchan's 'Jumma Chumma De De'. The viral video is being shared widely across platforms.

Gege Akutami's Mojuro: Everything to know about the Jujutsu Kaisen spin-offDespite its successful run, 'Jujutsu Kaisen' concluded suddenly in 2024, leaving fans eager to see what creator Gege Akutami would work on next.

Jaydon deserved his father: Dalljiet Kaur on Shalin's absence from son's lifeActor Dalljiet Kaur has opened up about former husband Shalin Bhanot's absence from their son Jaydon's life. The actors got married in 2009 and separated in 2015.

Giorgio Armani dies at 91: Leonardo DiCaprio to Sonam Kapoor, celebs pay tributeItalian fashion designer Giorgio Armani died on September 4.He was 91. Many celebrities like Sonam Kapoor, Leonardo DiCaprio, and Reese Witherspoon among others, paid their tributes to the late designer.

Vivek Agnihotri alleges theatres in Bengal threatened against screening The Bengal FilesFilmmaker Vivek Agnihotri recently shared that his film 'The Bengal Files' cannot be released in West Bengal, and is seeking legal recourse for it.

Hrithik emotional after watching Saba in Songs of Paradise, recalls her strugglesHrithik Roshan was moved by girlfriend Saba Azad's performance in 'Songs of Paradise.' In his heartfelt note, the actor praised her acting and recalled her struggles.

STR 49: Silambarasan steps into Vetri Maaran's Vada Chennai universeThe official glimpse of Vetri Maaran's 'STR 49', starring Silambarasan TR, has been unveiled, promising a gripping new chapter in the 'Vada Chennai' universe.

Baaghi 4 certified A after CBFC cuts violence and adult scenesTiger Shroff's Baaghi 4 receives an A certificate after multiple CBFC cuts for violence and adult content. The film's runtime was shortened voluntarily, highlighting increasing censorship challenges in Bollywood.

Dulquer Salmaan crowns Naslen 'superstar', fans say the prophecy has begunDulquer Salmaan's "superstar" comment about Naslen shows his quick rise in Malayalam cinema. His recent film 'Lokah: Chapter 1' is currently ruling theatres.

Top films and series releasing on Prime Video this weekendRajkummar Rao's 'Maalik' and Vishnu Manchu's 'Kannappa' start streaming on the OTT platform this weekend. Tilly Ramsay's cooking show 'Dish It Out' comes out, and so does K Drama 'Confidence Queen'. Have is a look at the complete list of the latest Prime Video releases.

Singer Karan Aujla confirms performance on The Tonight Show with Jimmy FallonSinger Karan Aujla will perform on 'The Tonight Show with Jimmy Fallon' this Tuesday. Aujla will be the second Paunjabi singer to appear on the show after Diljit Dosanjh.

Archana Puran Singh's son Aaryamann and Yogita Bihani move in togetherAaryamann Sethi and his fiancee Yogita Bihani have moved in together to a house gifted by Archana Puran Singh and her husband Parmeet Sethi. The couple documented the process of moving in a vlog shared on Aaryamann's YouTube channel.

Majnu Bhai supremacy: Vijay Varma brings home Anil Kapoor's iconic Welcome paintingVijay Varma thrilled Bollywood fans by posing with the iconic Majnu Bhai painting from 'Welcome', reviving a beloved slice of cinematic humour that still brings joy years after its debut.

Punjab floods: Bollywood and Punjabi stars unite for relief effortsBollywood and Punjabi celebrities have stepped up to support flood-affected Punjab with monetary aid and relief efforts. Sonu Sood, Randeep Hooda, and Kapil Sharma extended their help.

Actor Sivakarthikeyan on Madharaasi: It's a Murugadoss film and I am in itAfter the blockbuster success of 'Amaran', Sivakarthikeyan has taken on a new challenge with 'Madharaasi', an action thriller directed by AR Murugadoss. In an interview with India Today, he discussed 'Madharaasi', doing action films, Tamil cinema's quest for a Rs 1000 crore-film and the satisfaction he receives as a producer.

You actor Penn Badgley welcomes identical twin boys with wife Domino KirkeAmerican actor Penn Badgley and wife Domino Kirke have welcomed identical twin sons. The couple shares emotional moments from the pregnancy and reflects on raising twins in today's world.

Congress's 'Bidi-Bihar' remark after GST reforms irks NDA: True character exposedCongress Kerala unit's tweet mocking Bihar and bidis under GST reforms sparked a political uproar. Bihar NDA leaders condemned the remark, calling it insult to the state.

How dare you? Video of Ajit Pawar rebuking woman IPS officer goes viralIn the viral video, Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar was heard telling IPS officer Anjana Krishna to halt the police crackdown on illegal murrum excavation in Maharashtra's Solapur.

Why pizza orders were tracked amid Trump is Dead buzzEarlier this week, when speculation over Donald Trump's alleged death was swirling, the Pentagon Pizza Index surged by 800%. Pizza orders near the Pentagon—the headquarters of the US Defence Department—are considered a barometer, hinting at officials at work for hours, during a crunch situation. This was also the case in June when the US bombed Iran. Even Soviet spies kept an eye on pizza orders during the Cold War.

Staged it hoping I was watching: Trump jabs Xi over China's huge military showUS President Donald Trump called China's largest military parade impressive but staged to catch his attention. He also faulted Xi Jinping for not mentioning US contributions in World War 2.

How Gavin Newsom, whose ex-wife dated Trump Jr, became Trump's biggest rivalCalifornia Governor and Democrat Gavin Newsom has embraced Trump-style online trolling, targeting Trump and his aides, boosting his poll numbers. His shift from civil messaging to memes and viral content has shaken Republicans and energised Democrats. Adding drama, his ex-wife Kimberly Guilfoyle later became Trump Jr's fiancee, before the couple called off their engagement.

Fake IAS officer arrested in Lucknow; high-end cars, forged passes seizedSaurabh Tripathi allegedly flaunted luxury cars with fake government passes and even attended high-profile events in several states posing as an IAS officer.

Row erupts over 'Halal lifestyle township' project near MumbaiA promotional video for a housing project near Mumbai has sparked a row, with political parties alleging it promotes exclusivity on religious lines.

Beyond the parade: Decoding China's message to rivals and allies alikeChinese observers say that the event is meant to be an ultimatum to the Japanese side to retreat, particularly on the Taiwan issue. China hopes that the exhibition of strength will make Japan more restrained and prevent it from taking the "Taiwan's problems are Japan's problems" stance.

Scenarios explainedThe Super 4s stage is wide open, but India holds the advantage over the rest following their 4-1 win against Malaysia on Thursday, September 4. Here's what all four teams need to make it to the final of the Asia Cup on Sunday.

sports.headline: From despair to dominance: India's redemption against MalaysiaIndia overcame an early setback to beat Malaysia 4-1 in a crucial Asia Cup clash. After the disappointment of a draw against Korea, Harmanpreet Singh's men showed resilience and character to secure an important win and move a step closer to the final.

Could this young star be Argentina's next Messi? Former boss weighs inJose Pekerman believes 18-year-old Franco Mastantuono could be the closest successor to Lionel Messi, but Argentina manager Lionel Scaloni insists that no one can match Messi's unparalleled legacy.

Osaka's resurgent run ends as Anisimova books final date vs SabalenkaUS Open 2025: Amanda Anisimova staged a remarkable comeback to beat Naomi Osaka in the US Open semi-final. She will face defending champion Aryna Sabalenka in the final.

Asia Cup Hockey daily digest: India sing redemption song in Rajgir, inch closer to finalThe Indian team produced a stunning performance to come back from a goal down to beat Malaysia 4-1 and take a big step towards qualifying for the Asia Cup 2025 final. But familiar foes in the form of China awaits Harmanpreet Singh and his side with all four teams retaining a chance to make it to the summit clash. Alan John joins hands with veteran sports journalist Sundeep Misra for the analysis of the second round of the Super 4s and the final set of matches of the phase on September 6.

Punjab's son, Oman's leader: Jatinder Singh eyes Asia Cup glory in the UAEJatinder Singh, the Ludhiana-born cricketer who now captains Oman, spoke to India Today in an exclusive interview about the team's preparations for the upcoming Asia Cup and the challenges that arose after a pay dispute with 11 players following the T20 World Cup.

Lionel Messi remains coy on Argentina future: I haven't decided about World CupLionel Messi said he has not yet decided if he will play at the 2026 World Cup after scoring twice in Argentina's 3-0 win over Venezuela in Buenos Aires, his last World Cup qualifier at home.

Suryakumar, Hardik join coach Gambhir as India squad arrives in DubaiAsia Cup 2025: India players and head coach Gautam Gambhir arrived in Dubai on Thursday evening. The team will hold its first training session on Friday, five days before their tournament opener against the UAE.

Ross Taylor ends retirement to play for Samoa: NZ great's decision explainedRoss Taylor has reversed his retirement to represent Samoa in the 2026 T20 World Cup qualifier. The 41-year-old said he is still fit enough to run around and is keen on boosting the profile of cricket in Samoa.

Daniel Levy steps down as Tottenham Hotspur chairman after divisive 25-year tenureDaniel Levy has stepped down as Tottenham Hotspur chairman, the club announced on Thursday, bringing an end to a nearly 25-year tenure marked by financial stability but a lack of major silverware.

Molineux set to make return as Australia name squad for Women's ODI World CupSophie Molineux has been named in Australia's 15-player squad for the ODI World Cup in India and Sri Lanka and is expected to be fit in time. Leg-spinner Georgia Wareham has also recovered from the injury that cut short her Hundred campaign.

Breetzke sets ODI world record to help South Africa clinch series win vs EnglandSouth Africa's Matthew Breetzke became the first player to score half-centuries in each of his first five ODI appearances, setting up his side's gripping, series-clinching five-run victory over England at Lord's on Thursday.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
